gurmukhi: ਲੋਚਨ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਸਮ ਲੋਸਟ ਕਨਿਕ ਤਾ ਕੈ ਸ੍ਵਨ ੳੁਸਤਤਿ ਨਿੰਦਾ ਸਮਸਰਿ ਜਾਨੀਅੈ
transliteration: Lochan Dhiaan Sam Losat Kanik Taa Kai , Sravan Ousatati Nindaa Samasari Jaaneeai ?
translation: For a devoted Sikh of the Guru, a lump of earth and gold are equal in value. Thus, praise and slander for him are the same.

gurmukhi: ਨਾਸਕਾ ਸੁਗੰਧ ਬਿਰਗੰਧ ਸਮ ਤੁਲਿ ਤਾ ਕੈ ਰਿਦੈ ਮਿਤ੍ਰ ਸਤ੍ਰ ਸਮਸਰਿ ੳੁਨਮਾਨੀਅੈ
transliteration: Naasakaa Sougandh Biragandh Sam Tuli Taa Kai , Ridai Mitr Satr Samasari Ounamaaneeai ?
translation: For that devoted Sikh, both fragrance and foul smell means nothing. So he treats both friend and foe alike.

gurmukhi: ਰਸਨ ਸੁਅਾਦ ਬਿਖ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤੁ ਸਮਾਨਿ ਤਾ ਕੈ ਕਰ ਸਪਰਸ ਜਲ ਅਗਨਿ ਸਮਾਨੀਅੈ
transliteration: Rasan Suaad Bikh Anmritu Samaani Taa Kai , Kar Saparas Jal Agani Samaaneeai ?
translation: For him the taste of poison is not different from that of nectar. He feels the touch of water and fire alike.

gurmukhi: ਦੁਖ ਸੁਖ ਸਮਸਰਿ ਬਿਅਾਪੈ ਨ ਹਰਖ ਸੋਗੁ ਜੀਵਨ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਗਤਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਗਿਅਾਨੀਅੈ ॥੧੦੪॥
transliteration: Doukh Soukh Samasari Biaapai N Harakh Sogu , Jeevan Moukati Gati Satigur Giaaneeai ?104?
translation: He treats comforts and distresses alike. These two emotions do not influence him. By the benign and magnificence of a True Guru, who has blessed him with Naam, he achieves emancipation while living a house-holder's life. (104)
